member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.BooleanFormatter
member.summary: Provides a simple failure message, without any details of specific validation errors.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.FormatterBase
member.summary: Look at documentation.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter
member.summary: Interface for custom formatters, which are used to generate output from schema validation.
member.remarks:
Provides formatting methods for Schematron specific elements and for validation through the . Custom formatters implement methods to provide message formatting.
Am abstract base implementation is provided in to ease the extending process.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(NMatrix.Schematron.Test,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Provides formatting of both and elements.
member.remarks: Implementations may use the received context to add details to the output message. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The current navigator node where the test failed.
The message to output.
The or element which failed.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(NMatrix.Schematron.Rule,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Provides formatting for a element.
member.remarks: Implementations may use the received context to add details to the output message. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The navigator where the inner or elements failed.
The message to output.
The element containing failed or elements.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(NMatrix.Schematron.Pattern,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Provides formatting for a element.
member.remarks: Implementations may use the received context to add details to the output message. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The source document navigator where evaluation took place.
The message to output.
The element containing failed elements.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(NMatrix.Schematron.Phase,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Provides formatting for a element.
member.remarks: Implementations may use the received context to add details to the output message. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.

The message to output.

member.remarks: Implementations may use the received context to add details to the output message. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(System.Xml.XmlValidatingReader,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Provides formatting for a element being validated through a .
member.remarks: Usually will output schema-level formatting for XmlSchema validation. Recall that multiple schemas may have been configured with the reader and validated simultaneously. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The message to output.
The reader in use to validate the schema.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(System.Xml.Schema.ValidationEventArgs,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Formats the output of XmlSchema validation.
member.remarks: The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The message to output.
The argument received by the handler during XmlSchema validation.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaCollection,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Enclosing message for all schemas being validated.
member.remarks: Usually will add any enclosing message to the results of the global Xml validation. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The message to output.
The collection of schemas in use for validation.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(NMatrix.Schematron.SchemaCollection,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Enclosing message for all schemas being validated.
member.remarks: Usually will add any enclosing message to the results of the global Schematron validation. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The message to output.
The collection of schemas in use for validation.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.IFormatter.Format(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Formats the whole message built so far.
member.remarks: Usually will perform any last-minute formatting of the whole message before being returned by the calling application. For example, the uses this method to enclose the whole message in an <output> element. The contains messages accumulated so far in the validation process.
member.param: The message to output.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Formatters.FormattingUtils.GetFullNodePosition(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.String,NMatrix.Schematron.Test,System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Returns the full path to the context node. Clone the navigator to avoid loosing positioning.
member.remarks: Cloning is not performed inside this method because it is called recursively. Keeping positioning is only relevant to the calling procedure, not subsequent recursive calls. This way we avoid creating unnecessary objects.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Assert
member.summary: Represents an assert element of the Schematron schema.
member.remarks:
As stated in the , this is the lowest element in a Schematron schema. This element contains the expression to execute in the context of its parent .
If the results of the execution of the expression are False, the assert fails and the correponding message will be displayed.
Constructor is not public. To programatically create an instance of this class use the factory method.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Test
member.summary: Base class for testing units of Schematron, such as Assert or Report elements.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluableExpression
member.summary: Base class for elements that can be evaluated by an XPath expression.
member.remarks: This class performs the expression compilation, and provides access to the context through two methods.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.CompiledExpressions
member.summary: This class keeps static precompiled expressions used in the Schematron schema loading and validation processes.
member.remarks: All expressions are compiled against the object. All the objects are initialized with the for schematron and XML Schema namespaces resolution.

member.summary: Provides global settings for Schematron validation.
member.remarks: This class is public to allow inheritors of Schematron elements to use these global settings.

member.summary: Initializes global settings.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Config.Setup
member.summary: Force all static constructors in the library.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.Config.DefaultFormatter
member.summary: The default object to use to format messages from validation.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.Config.DefaultNavigator
member.summary: A default empty navigator used to pre-compile XPath expressions.
member.remarks: Compiling doesn't involve any namespace, name table or other specific processing. It's only a parsing procedure that builds the abstract syntax tree for later evaluation. So we can safely use an empty to compile them against.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.Config.DefaultNsManager
member.summary: Manager to use when executing expressions that validate or load Schematron and Embedded Schematron schemas.

member.summary: A cached schema in Schematron format to validate schematron schemas.
member.remarks: This is the version for standalone schemas.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.Config.EmbeddedSchematron
member.summary: A cached schema in Schematron format to validate schematron schemas.
member.remarks: This is the version for embedded schemas.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.Config.UniqueKey
member.summary: A unique identifier to use for internal keys.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.DomMatchedNodes
member.summary: Strategy class for matching and keeping references to nodes in an xml document.
member.remarks: When an is created from an , it implements the interface, which is used to gain access to the underlying node.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.IMatchedNodes
member.summary: Defines the common interface used by the different node-matching strategies.
member.remarks:
As different can exist, and even be developed in the future, we have to take into account that the data store can change. So in order to be efficient at keeping nodes matched so far, to satisfy the , we provide a common interface and an implementation optimized for specific stores.
Each navigator implementation typically provides an interface to let applications get access to the underlying store, such as the or interfaces, implemented in navigators create by or classes.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.IMatchedNodes.IsMatched(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Checks if an specific node has already been matched.
member.param: The node to check.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.IMatchedNodes.AddMatched(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Adds a node to the list of nodes matched so far.
member.param: The node to add.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.IMatchedNodes.Clear
member.summary: Clears the list of matched nodes.

member.summary: We use an optimized collection for saving the hash codes.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase
member.summary: Base class for Schematron evaluation contexts.
member.remarks:
The schematron elements don't provide evaluation code. They just represent the elements in the .
For evaluation purposes, this class provides the iteration and execution process, accumulates results, moves the cursor, etc. Here is where the actual evaluation takes place. This way we isolate the schema design from the different execution models we can use, for example, (we may add asynchonous execution later).
The validator classes provided use instances of this strategy object to validate documents provided by the user.

member.name: F:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Matched
member.summary: Keeps a list of nodes already matched.
member.remarks: When the property is set, the appropriate strategy for matching nodes is initialized, depending on the specific implementation of the in use.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.#ctor
member.summary: Creates the evaluation context

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Start
member.summary: Starts the evaluation process.
member.remarks: When the process is finished, the results are placed in the property.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Reset
member.summary: Resets the state of the current context.
member.remarks: By default, it clears the and sets to false.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Formatter
member.summary: Gets or sets the class to use to format messages.
member.remarks: This object is initialized to the instance. Usually, it will be changed based on parameters passed to the validator class, or exposed directly by it.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Messages
member.summary: Gets or sets the messages generated by the validation process.
member.remarks: Specific implementations of this class read/write this property while they accumulate validation messages.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.HasErrors
member.summary: Indicates if errors were found during the current evaluation.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Phase
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific validation phase to run.
member.remarks: Schematron supports the concept of phases, where different sets of patterns can be executed at different times. This phase is initialized to , which will mean all patterns are run.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema to use for the validation.

member.name: P:NMatrix.Schematron.EvaluationContextBase.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the document to validate.
member.remarks: When this property is set, the appropriate strategy is picked, to perform optimum for various navigator implementations.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.GenericMatchedNodes
member.summary: Strategy class for matching and keeping references to nodes in an unknown implementation of .
member.remarks: This implementation uses the standard to know if a navigator has already been matched. This is not optimum because a complete traversal of nodes matched so far has to be performed, but it will work with all implementations of .

member.name: F:NMatrix.Schematron.GenericMatchedNodes._matched
member.summary: Uses a simple arraylist to keep the navigators.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Phase
member.summary: A Phase element, containing the active elements.
member.remarks:
The allows a certaing degree of workflow through the use of phases. A document can have several states, and therefore different sets of rules should be checked against it.
This element allows execution of a set of 'active' patterns.
Constructor is not public. To programatically create an instance of this class use the factory method.

member.name: F:NMatrix.Schematron.Phase.All
member.summary: The identifier to check for All phases.
member.remarks: Causes all the patterns in a schema to be checked, irrespective of the phases where they are activated.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Report
member.summary: A Report element.
member.remarks:
As stated in the , this is the other lowest element (aside from ) in a Schematron schema. This element contains the expression to execute in the context of its parent .
If the results of the execution of the expression are true, the report succeeds and the correponding message will be displayed.
Constructor is not public. To programatically create an instance of this class use the factory method.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Report.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the parameters specified.
member.param: The XPath expression to test.
The message to return.

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.Rule
member.summary: A Rule element.
member.remarks:
Rules enclose the and elements, providing the context for their evaluation. According to the , nodes can be evaluated by only one rule inside a , so typical schema design includes placing the most exceptional rules first, down to more generally applicable ones.
Constructor is not public. To programatically create an instance of this class use the factory method.
member.author: Should we add support for the key element?

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Rule.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an abstract rule, without context.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Rule.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the received context.
member.param: The rule's context to evaluate.
member.remarks: If passed a null or an , this is implicitly an abstract rule.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Rule.InitContext(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the context for the rule.
member.param: The rule's context to evaluate.
member.remarks: If passed a null or an , this is implicitly an abstract rule.
member.author: Rules are evaluated through all the document (//), unless they explicitly want to start from the root (/). This is consistent with XSLT template match behavior. So we have to split the expression per union (|) to add the root expression in these cases.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.Rule.CreateAssert(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new assert instance.
member.remarks: Inheritors should override this method to create instances of their own assert implementations.
member.param: The XPath expression to test for the assert. See .
The message to display if the assert fails. See .

member.summary: Creates a new report instance.

The message to display if the report succeeds. See .

member.name: T:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext
member.summary: Evaluates all the schema elements synchronously.
member.remarks: See for a description of the purpose and of evaluation contexts, and where are they used.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.#ctor
member.summary: Creates the evaluation context

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.Start
member.summary: Starts the evaluation process.
member.remarks: When the process is finished, the results are placed in the property.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.Evaluate(NMatrix.Schematron.Phase,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Evaluates the selected .
member.remarks: As most of the other evaluation methods, it repositions the navigator on the root node.
member.param: The to evaluate.
Contains the builder to accumulate messages in.
member.returns: A boolean indicating the presence of errors (true).

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.Evaluate(NMatrix.Schematron.Pattern,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Evaluates the selected .
member.remarks:
As most of the other evaluation methods, it repositions the navigator on the root node.
Clears the object before proceeding, as the restriction about node mathing (see ) applies only inside a single pattern.
member.param: The to evaluate.
Contains the builder to accumulate messages in.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if a new message was added.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.Evaluate(NMatrix.Schematron.Rule,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Evaluates the selected .
member.remarks:
and are iterated and each and is executed against the context selected by the .
Nodes matched are added to the list of nodes to skip in the next rule, using the method. This object is a strategy object which implements different algorithms for matching and saving node references, as the actual implementation provides different methods for accessing the underlying source.
This makes the implementation both performant and compliant with the restriction about node mathing (see ) in the spec.
As most of the other evaluation methods, it repositions the navigator on the root node.
member.param: The to evaluate.
Contains the builder to accumulate messages in.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if a new message was added.
member.exception: The rule to evaluate is abstract (see ).

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.EvaluateAssert(NMatrix.Schematron.Assert,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Performs the evaluation of the .
member.remarks: This is where the actual assert expression is evaluated. If the returns false, a formated message is generated from the property.
member.param: The to evaluate.
The context node for the execution.
Contains the builder to accumulate messages in.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if a new message was added.

member.name: M:NMatrix.Schematron.SyncEvaluationContext.EvaluateReport(NMatrix.Schematron.Report,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Performs the evaluation of the .
member.remarks: This is where the actual report expression is evaluated. If the returns true, a formated message is generated from the property.
member.param: The to evaluate.
The context node for the execution.
Contains the builder to accumulate messages in.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if a new message was added.
